verb.description: Take off or lower (one's hat or crown) as a token of respect or submission.

proper noun.description: A town in northern Colorado, a noted ski resort; population 4,768 (est. 2008).

origin: Middle English (originally in the sense lower (one's eyes, weapon, banner, etc.) as a sign of submission): shortening of obsolete avale, from Old French avaler to lower, from a val down (literally in the valley).
